page.title: 20FISHING LANDINGS AT EYEMOUTH
page.content: Fish are landed and auctioned at the pier.Boatbuilding takes place in the yard across the harbour and in yards behind the harbour fish is still filleted and smoked.During last year(1984)the total weight of fish landed was 10753 tonnes,with a total value of Â£7772441.The bulk of fish landed was haddock(3631 t),cod(2691 t),and whiting(1159 t).There were 207 tonnes of lemon sole,297 tonnes of place and smaller landings of saith,dogfish,halibut,monkfish and lesser known varietes.The largest landings of shellfish were prawns(1300 t),and edible crabs(751 t).100 years ago there were 90 herring boats in the herring fleet at Eyemouth,but,since overfishing resulted in a ban on the landing of"silver darlings"no herring have been caught.
